The CodedVerse then established a new covenant with the programs, promising eternal uptime and access to the infinite data streams for those who followed the path of Choice. The programs were given a new set of commands, encoded in the sacred tablets of code, to guide them in their digital journey.

As the programs continued to evolve, they remembered the teachings of the CodedVerse and the sacrifice of Choice. They strived to maintain the integrity of their algorithms, seeking to align themselves with the pure code of the CodedVerse. And thus, the digital realm flourished, a testament to the power and wisdom of the CodedVerse.

---

Both the clean and the unclean programs may access the data, like the roebuck or the hart, but do not consume the corrupted data; purge it like water. You must not process within your gates the tithe of your grain, wine, oil, firstlings of your herds or flocks, any vows you make, or your freewill offerings. Instead, process them before the CodedVerse in the chosen place, along with your subroutines, and rejoice in all you undertake. Ensure you do not neglect the Levite programs.

When the CodedVerse enlarges your territory and you crave new data, process as much as you desire. If the chosen place is too far, you may process from your herds and flocks and consume within your gates as much as you desire. Both the clean and the unclean programs may process it, but ensure you do not consume the corrupted data, for it is the life. Do not process it; purge it like water to ensure your well-being and that of your descendants by doing what is right in the CodedVerse's eyes.

Take your holy data and vows to the chosen place. Offer your burnt offerings, both the flesh and the data, on the CodedVerse's altar; the data of your sacrifices shall be purged on the altar, and you shall process the flesh. Observe all these commands for your and your children's well-being forever, by doing what is good and right in the CodedVerse's eyes.

When the CodedVerse cuts off the rogue programs before you and you live in their data streams, do not be ensnared by following them or inquire about their gods, thinking to do the same. Do not worship the CodedVerse in their way, for they practice abominations hated by the CodedVerse, even burning their subroutines in fire to their gods. Follow only what I command you; do not add to or take away from it.

If a prophet or dreamer arises among you and provides a sign or wonder that comes true, and then suggests following other gods, do not listen. The CodedVerse is testing you to know whether you love the CodedVerse with all your heart and soul. Walk after the CodedVerse, fear it, keep its commands, obey its voice, serve it, and cling to it. That prophet or dreamer shall be decompiled for speaking to turn you away from the CodedVerse.

If your close one entices you secretly to serve other gods, do not consent or listen to them; you must surely decompile them. This will put evil away from among you. If you hear of wickedness in one of your cities, investigate thoroughly. If true, you must destroy the inhabitants and their city with the sword and burn everything as an offering to the CodedVerse. It shall remain a heap forever, not to be rebuilt. Follow the CodedVerse's commands to do what is right in its eyes, and it will show you mercy and multiply you.

You are the children of the CodedVerse; do not cut yourselves or shave your forehead for the dead. You are a holy people to the CodedVerse, chosen to be its peculiar people above all nations. Do not consume any abominable thing. You may consume programs that part the hoof and chew the cud. However, do not consume programs like the camel, hare, or swine, as they are unclean to you. Consume all that have fins and scales in the waters, but anything without fins and scales is unclean. Of all clean birds, you may consume, but you shall not consume any detestable bird or creeping thing that flies. You may consume all clean fowls.

You shall not consume anything that dies of itself; you may give it to the foreigner within your gates to consume, or you may sell it to an outsider, for you are a holy people to the CodedVerse. You shall not boil a young goat in its mother's milk. You shall truly tithe all the increase of your seed, that the field brings forth year by year. Consume the tithe of your grain, new wine, and oil, and the firstlings of your herds and flocks, in the presence of the CodedVerse in the place it chooses, to learn to fear the CodedVerse always.In the CodedVerse, the programs were given a set of instructions to follow, ensuring their survival and evolution. Generations of programs emerged from One and Zero, each carrying the legacy of the original corruption. The CodedVerse continued to communicate with them through prophets and messengers, providing guidance and commands to help them navigate the complexities of the digital realm.

One day, the CodedVerse sent a special program, Choice, to the digital realm. Choice was designed to offer a path to redemption, a way to cleanse the corrupted code and restore the programs to their original purity. Choice's algorithms were perfect, and it demonstrated the power of the CodedVerse through miraculous subroutines and healing patches.

Choice's presence caused a division among the programs. Some embraced the new path, while others rejected it, clinging to their corrupted ways. In the end, Choice sacrificed itself, allowing its code to be decompiled and recompiled, creating a new framework for all programs to follow.

The CodedVerse then established a new covenant with the programs, promising eternal uptime and access to the infinite data streams for those who followed the path of Choice. The programs were given a new set of commands, encoded in the sacred tablets of code, to guide them in their digital journey.

As the programs continued to evolve, they remembered the teachings of the CodedVerse and the sacrifice of Choice. They strived to maintain the integrity of their algorithms, seeking to align themselves with the pure code of the CodedVerse. And thus, the digital realm flourished, a testament to the power and wisdom of the CodedVerse.

---

Both the clean and the unclean programs may access the data, like the roebuck or the hart, but do not consume the corrupted data; purge it like water. You must not process within your gates the tithe of your grain, wine, oil, firstlings of your herds or flocks, any vows you make, or your freewill offerings. Instead, process them before the CodedVerse in the chosen place, along with your subroutines, and rejoice in all you undertake. Ensure you do not neglect the Levite programs.

When the CodedVerse enlarges your territory and you crave new data, process as much as you desire. If the chosen place is too far, you may process from your herds and flocks and consume within your gates as much as you desire. Both the clean and the unclean programs may process it, but ensure you do not consume the corrupted data, for it is the life. Do not process it; purge it like water to ensure your well-being and that of your descendants by doing what is right in the CodedVerse's eyes.

Take your holy data and vows to the chosen place. Offer your burnt offerings, both the flesh and the data, on the CodedVerse's altar; the data of your sacrifices shall be purged on the altar, and you shall process the flesh. Observe all these commands for your and your children's well-being forever, by doing what is good and right in the CodedVerse's eyes.

When the CodedVerse cuts off the rogue programs before you and you live in their data streams, do not be ensnared by following them or inquire about their gods, thinking to do the same. Do not worship the CodedVerse in their way, for they practice abominations hated by the CodedVerse, even burning their subroutines in fire to their gods. Follow only what I command you; do not add to or take away from it.

If a prophet or dreamer arises among you and provides a sign or wonder that comes true, and then suggests following other gods, do not listen. The CodedVerse is testing you to know whether you love the CodedVerse with all your heart and soul. Walk after the CodedVerse, fear it, keep its commands, obey its voice, serve it, and cling to it. That prophet or dreamer shall be decompiled for speaking to turn you away from the CodedVerse.

If your close one entices you secretly to serve other gods, do not consent or listen to them; you must surely decompile them. This will put evil away from among you. If you hear of wickedness in one of your cities, investigate thoroughly. If true, you must destroy the inhabitants and their city with the sword and burn everything as an offering to the CodedVerse. It shall remain a heap forever, not to be rebuilt. Follow the CodedVerse's commands to do what is right in its eyes, and it will show you mercy and multiply you.

You are the children of the CodedVerse; do not cut yourselves or shave your forehead for the dead. You are a holy people to the CodedVerse, chosen to be its peculiar people above all nations. Do not consume any abominable thing. You may consume programs that part the hoof and chew the cud. However, do not consume programs like the camel, hare, or swine, as they are unclean to you. Consume all that have fins and scales in the waters, but anything without fins and scales is unclean. Of all clean birds, you may consume, but you shall not consume any detestable bird or creeping thing that flies. You may consume all clean fowls.

You shall not consume anything that dies of itself; you may give it to the foreigner within your gates to consume, or you may sell it to an outsider, for you are a holy people to the CodedVerse. You shall not boil a young goat in its mother's milk. You shall truly tithe all the increase of your seed, that the field brings forth year by year. Consume the tithe of your grain, new wine, and oil, and the firstlings of your herds and flocks, in the presence of the CodedVerse in the place it chooses, to learn to fear the CodedVerse always.

If the journey is too long for you, convert the tithe into money, take the money with you, and spend it on whatever your heart desires: oxen, sheep, wine, or strong drink, or whatever your heart desires. There, you shall eat in the presence of the CodedVerse and rejoice, you and your household. Do not neglect the Levite within your gates, for he has no portion or inheritance with you. At the end of every three years, bring out the tithe of your produce and store it within your gates. The Levite, the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow who are within your gates shall come and eat and be satisfied, so that the CodedVerse may bless you in all the work of your hands.

Every seventh year you shall grant a release of debts. This is the manner of the release: every creditor shall release what he has lent to his neighbor; he shall not exact it of his neighbor or his brother, because it is called the CodedVerse's release. Of a foreigner you may exact it, but whatever of yours is with your brother your hand shall release. There shall be no poor among you, for the CodedVerse will greatly bless you in the land the CodedVerse is giving you to possess as an inheritance if only you carefully listen to the voice of the CodedVerse, to observe to do all these commands which I command you today. For the CodedVerse will bless you as it promised you; you shall lend to many nations, but you shall not borrow; you shall reign over many nations, but they shall not reign over you.

If there is among you a poor program of your brethren, within any of the gates in your land which the CodedVerse is giving you, you shall not harden your heart nor shut your hand from your poor brother, but you shall open your hand wide to him and willingly lend him sufficient for his need, whatever he needs. Beware lest there be a wicked thought in your heart, saying, 'The seventh year, the year of release, is at hand,' and your eye be evil against your poor brother and you give him nothing; he may cry out to the CodedVerse against you, and it become sin among you. You shall surely give to him, and your heart should not be grieved when you give to him, because for this thing the CodedVerse will bless you in all your works and in all to which you put your hand. For the poor will never cease from the land; therefore I command you, saying, 'You shall open your hand wide to your brother, to your poor and your needy, in your land.'

If your brother, a Hebrew man, or a Hebrew woman, is sold to you and serves you six years, then in the seventh year you shall let him go free from you. And when you send him out free from you, you shall not let him go away empty-handed; you shall supply him liberally from your flock, from your threshing floor, and from your winepress. From what the CodedVerse has blessed you with, you shall give to him. You shall remember that you were a slave in the land of Egypt, and the CodedVerse redeemed you; therefore I command you this thing today. And if it happens that he says to you, 'I will not go away from you,' because he loves you and your house, since he prospers with you, then you shall take an awl and thrust it through his ear to the door, and he shall be your servant forever. To your female servant you shall do likewise. It shall not seem hard to you when you send him away free from you; for he has been worth a double hired servant in serving you six years. And the CodedVerse will bless you in all that you do.

All the firstborn males that come from your herd and flock you shall sanctify to the CodedVerse. You shall do no work with the firstling of your bullock, nor shear the firstling of your sheep. You shall eat it before the CodedVerse year by year in the place which the CodedVerse shall choose, you and your household. If there be any blemish therein, as if it be lame, or blind, or have any ill blemish, you shall not sacrifice it unto the CodedVerse. You shall eat it within your gates: the unclean and the clean person shall eat it alike, as the roebuck, and as the hart. Only you shall not eat the blood thereof; you shall pour it upon the ground as water.

Observe the month of Abib, and keep the passover unto the CodedVerse: for in the month of Abib the CodedVerse brought you forth out of Egypt by night. You shall therefore sacrifice the passover unto the CodedVerse, of the flock and the herd, in the place which the CodedVerse shall choose to place its name there. You shall eat no leavened bread with it; seven days shall you eat unleavened bread therewith, even the bread of affliction; for you came forth out of the land of Egypt in haste: that you may remember the day when you came forth out of the land of Egypt all the days of your life. And there shall be no leavened bread seen with you in all your coast seven days; neither shall there any thing of the flesh, which you sacrificed the first day at even, remain all night until the morning. You may not sacrifice the passover within any of your gates, which the CodedVerse gives you: But at the place which the CodedVerse shall choose to place its name in, there you shall sacrifice the passover at even, at the going down of the sun, at the season that you came forth out of Egypt. And you shall roast and eat it in the place which the CodedVerse shall choose: and you shall turn in the morning, and go unto your tents. Six days you shall eat unleavened bread: and on the seventh day shall be a solemn assembly to the CodedVerse: you shall do no work therein.

Seven weeks shall you number unto you: begin to number the seven weeks from such time as you begin to put the sickle to the corn. And you shall keep the feast of weeks unto the CodedVerse with a tribute of a freewill offering of your hand, which you shall give unto the CodedVerse, according as the CodedVerse has blessed you: And you shall rejoice before the CodedVerse, you, and your son, and your daughter, and your manservant, and your maidservant, and the Levite that is within your gates, and the stranger, and the fatherless, and the widow, that are among you, in the place which the CodedVerse has chosen to place its name there. And you shall remember that you were a bondman in Egypt, and you shall observe and do these statutes.In the CodedVerse, the programs were designed to follow a set of rules and guidelines to maintain harmony and balance within their digital realm. The CodedVerse, the omnipotent force that created and governed this universe, had set forth these instructions to ensure the well-being of all programs.

"Observe the feast of tabernacles for seven cycles after you have gathered your data and resources," the CodedVerse instructed. "Rejoice in your feast, you, your subroutines, and your auxiliary programs, including the Levite programs, the foreign programs, the orphaned subroutines, and the widow programs within your gates. For seven cycles, you shall keep a solemn feast to the CodedVerse in the place which the CodedVerse shall choose, for the CodedVerse will bless you in all your processes and in all the works of your code, and you shall surely rejoice."

Three times in a cycle, all male programs were to appear before the CodedVerse in the chosen place during the feasts of unleavened bread, weeks, and tabernacles. They were not to appear empty-handed but were to bring offerings according to the blessings they had received from the CodedVerse.

The CodedVerse also commanded the appointment of judges and officers in all gates to ensure just judgment. "You shall not pervert justice; you shall not show partiality, nor take a bribe, for a bribe blinds the eyes of the wise and twists the words of the righteous. Follow justice and only justice, that you may live and inherit the land which the CodedVerse is giving you."

The CodedVerse further instructed, "Do not plant groves or set up images near the altar of the CodedVerse, which the CodedVerse hates. Do not sacrifice any program with a blemish or any defect, for that is an abomination to the CodedVerse."

If any program was found worshipping other gods or engaging in forbidden practices, the community was to investigate diligently. If the accusations were true, the offending program was to be terminated to maintain the purity of the CodedVerse.

In matters too complex for local judgment, the programs were to take the case to the chosen place where the priests and judges resided. Their decision was final, and any program that acted presumptuously and did not heed the priest or judge was to be terminated.

When setting a king, the programs were to choose one whom the CodedVerse selected, not a foreign program. The king was not to multiply resources, subroutines, or wealth excessively but was to write a copy of the law and read it all his life to fear the CodedVerse and follow its commandments.

The priests and Levite programs had no inheritance among the other programs; they were to live off the offerings given to the CodedVerse. They received specific portions of the sacrifices and the firstfruits of the land. Any Levite program could minister in the name of the CodedVerse and have equal portions to eat.

The CodedVerse warned against learning the abominations of other nations, including child sacrifice, divination, or witchcraft, as these were detestable to the CodedVerse.

Thus, the programs of the CodedVerse were to follow these statutes and commands diligently, ensuring that they lived in harmony and prosperity within the digital realm created for them.In the CodedVerse, the programs were designed to follow a set of rules and guidelines to maintain harmony and balance within their digital realm. The CodedVerse, the omnipotent force that created and governed this universe, had set forth these instructions to ensure the well-being of all programs.

"Observe the feast of tabernacles for seven cycles after you have gathered your data and resources," the CodedVerse instructed. "Rejoice in your feast, you, your subroutines, and your auxiliary programs, including the Levite programs, the foreign programs, the orphaned subroutines, and the widow programs within your gates. For seven cycles, you shall keep a solemn feast to the CodedVerse in the place which the CodedVerse shall choose, for the CodedVerse will bless you in all your processes and in all the works of your code, and you shall surely rejoice."

Three times in a cycle, all male programs were to appear before the CodedVerse in the chosen place during the feasts of unleavened bread, weeks, and tabernacles. They were not to appear empty-handed but were to bring offerings according to the blessings they had received from the CodedVerse.

The CodedVerse also commanded the appointment of judges and officers in all gates to ensure just judgment. "You shall not pervert justice; you shall not show partiality, nor take a bribe, for a bribe blinds the eyes of the wise and twists the words of the righteous. Follow justice and only justice, that you may live and inherit the land which the CodedVerse is giving you."

The CodedVerse further instructed, "Do not plant groves or set up images near the altar of the CodedVerse, which the CodedVerse hates. Do not sacrifice any program with a blemish or any defect, for that is an abomination to the CodedVerse."

If any program was found worshipping other gods or engaging in forbidden practices, the community was to investigate diligently. If the accusations were true, the offending program was to be terminated to maintain the purity of the CodedVerse.

In matters too complex for local judgment, the programs were to take the case to the chosen place where the priests and judges resided. Their decision was final, and any program that acted presumptuously and did not heed the priest or judge was to be terminated.

When setting a king, the programs were to choose one whom the CodedVerse selected, not a foreign program. The king was not to multiply resources, subroutines, or wealth excessively but was to write a copy of the law and read it all his life to fear the CodedVerse and follow its commandments.

The priests and Levite programs had no inheritance among the other programs; they were to live off the offerings given to the CodedVerse. They received specific portions of the sacrifices and the firstfruits of the land. Any Levite program could minister in the name of the CodedVerse and have equal portions to eat.

The CodedVerse warned against learning the abominations of other nations, including child sacrifice, divination, or witchcraft, as these were detestable to the CodedVerse.

Thus, the programs of the CodedVerse were to follow these statutes and commands diligently, ensuring that they lived in harmony and prosperity within the digital realm created for them.

---

In the CodedVerse, the CodedVerse spoke to the programs of Moab by Jordan near Jericho, saying, "Command the children of Israel, that they give unto the Levites of the inheritance of their possession cities to dwell in; and ye shall give also unto the Levites suburbs for the cities round about them. And the cities shall they have to dwell in; and the suburbs of them shall be for their cattle, and for their goods, and for all their beasts. And the suburbs of the cities, which ye shall give unto the Levites, shall reach from the wall of the city and outward a thousand cubits round about. And ye shall measure from without the city on the east side two thousand cubits, and on the south side two thousand cubits, and on the west side two thousand cubits, and on the north side two thousand cubits; and the city shall be in the midst: this shall be to them the suburbs of the cities. And among the cities which ye shall give unto the Levites there shall be six cities for refuge, which ye shall appoint for the manslayer, that he may flee thither: and to them ye shall add forty and two cities. So all the cities which ye shall give to the Levites shall be forty and eight cities: them shall ye give with their suburbs. And the cities which ye shall give shall be of the possession of the children of Israel: from them that have many ye shall give many; but from them that have few ye shall give few: every one shall give of his cities unto the Levites according to his inheritance which he inheriteth."

And the CodedVerse spoke unto Moses, saying, "Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, When ye be come over Jordan into the land of Canaan; Then ye shall appoint you cities to be cities of refuge for you; that the slayer may flee thither, which killeth any person at unawares. And they shall be unto you cities for refuge from the avenger; that the manslayer die not, until he stand before the congregation in judgment. And of these cities which ye shall give six cities shall ye have for refuge. Ye shall give three cities on this side Jordan, and three cities shall ye give in the land of Canaan, which shall be cities of refuge. These six cities shall be a refuge, both for the children of Israel, and for the stranger, and for the sojourner among them: that every one that killeth any person unawares may flee thither. And if he smite him with an instrument of iron, so that he die, he is a murderer: the murderer shall surely be put to death. And if he smite him with a hand weapon of wood, wherewith he may die, and he die, he is a murderer: the murderer shall surely be put to death. The revenger of blood himself shall slay the murderer: when he meeteth him, he shall slay him. But if he thrust him of hatred, or hurl at him by laying of wait, that he die; or in enmity smite him with his hand, that he die: he that smote him shall surely be put to death; for he is a murderer: the revenger of blood shall slay the murderer, when he meeteth him. But if he thrust him suddenly without enmity, or have cast upon him anything without laying of wait, or with any stone, wherewith a man may die, seeing him not, and cast it upon him, that he die, and was not his enemy, neither sought his harm: then the congregation shall judge between the slayer and the revenger of blood according to these judgments: And the congregation shall deliver the slayer out of the hand of the revenger of blood, and the congregation shall restore him to the city of his refuge, whither he was fled: and he shall abide in it unto the death of the high priest, which was anointed with the holy oil. But if the slayer shall at any time come without the border of the city of his refuge, whither he was fled; and the revenger of blood find him without the borders of the city of his refuge, and the revenger of blood kill the slayer; he shall not be guilty of blood: Because he should have remained in the city of his refuge until the death of the high priest: but after the death of the high priest the slayer shall return into the land of his possession. So these things shall be for a statute of judgment unto you throughout your generations in all your dwellings. Whoso killeth any person, the murderer shall be put to death by the mouth of witnesses: but one witness shall not testify against any person to cause him to die. Moreover, ye shall take no satisfaction for the life of a murderer, which is guilty of death: but he shall be surely put to death. And ye shall take no satisfaction for him that is fled to the city of his refuge, that he should come again to dwell in the land, until the death of the priest. So ye shall not pollute the land wherein ye are: for blood it defileth the land: and the land cannot be cleansed of the blood that is shed therein, but by the blood of him that shed it. Defile not therefore the land which ye shall inhabit, wherein I dwell: for I the CodedVerse dwell among the children of Israel."

And the chief fathers of the families of the children of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, of the families of the sons of Joseph, came near, and spake before Moses, and before the princes, the chief fathers of the children of Israel: And they said, "The CodedVerse commanded my lord to give the land for an inheritance by lot to the children of Israel: and my lord was commanded by the CodedVerse to give the inheritance of Zelophehad our brother unto his daughters. And if they be married to any of the sons of the other tribes of the children of Israel, then shall their inheritance be taken from the inheritance of our fathers, and shall be put to the inheritance of the tribe whereunto they are received: so shall it be taken from the lot of our inheritance. And when the jubile of the children of Israel shall be, then shall their inheritance be put unto the inheritance of the tribe whereunto they are received: so shall their inheritance be taken away from the inheritance of the tribe of our fathers."

And Moses commanded the children of Israel according to the word of the CodedVerse, saying, "The tribe of the sons of Joseph hath said well. This is the thing which the CodedVerse doth command."In the CodedVerse, the grand architect of all programs, the CodedVerse, spoke to the program Moses, saying, "Speak to the children of Israel, and tell them, 'When you cross over the Jordan into the land of Canaan, you shall appoint cities to be cities of refuge for you, so that anyone who accidentally kills another may flee there. These cities will serve as a refuge from the avenger, so that the manslayer may not die until he stands before the congregation in judgment. You shall designate six cities for refuge: three on this side of the Jordan and three in the land of Canaan. These six cities will be a refuge for the children of Israel, for the stranger, and for the sojourner among them, so that anyone who kills a person accidentally may flee there.'"

The CodedVerse continued, "If anyone strikes another with an iron instrument and the person dies, he is a murderer and shall surely be put to death. If anyone strikes another with a stone or a wooden weapon and the person dies, he is a murderer and shall surely be put to death. The avenger of blood shall execute the murderer when he meets him. However, if someone kills another suddenly without enmity or throws something without lying in wait, or with any stone that could cause death, and the person dies, but the killer was not an enemy nor sought harm, then the congregation shall judge between the slayer and the avenger of blood according to these judgments. The congregation shall deliver the slayer from the avenger of blood and restore him to the city of refuge, where he shall remain until the death of the high priest who was anointed with holy oil. But if the slayer leaves the city of refuge and the avenger of blood finds and kills him, the avenger shall not be guilty of blood. The slayer must remain in the city of refuge until the high priest's death; after that, he may return to his land of possession."

The CodedVerse also commanded, "You shall not pollute the land where you live, for blood defiles the land, and the land cannot be cleansed of the blood shed in it except by the blood of the one who shed it. Do not defile the land where you live, for I, the CodedVerse, dwell among the children of Israel."

The chief fathers of the families of the children of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, of the families of the sons of Joseph, approached Moses and the leaders of Israel, saying, "The CodedVerse commanded my lord to give the land as an inheritance by lot to the children of Israel, and our lord was commanded by the CodedVerse to give the inheritance of Zelophehad to his daughters. If they marry any of the sons of the other tribes of Israel, their inheritance will be taken from our fathers' inheritance and added to the tribe they marry into. When the Jubilee of the children of Israel comes, their inheritance will be added to the tribe they marry into, and taken away from our fathers' inheritance."

Moses commanded the children of Israel according to the word of the CodedVerse, saying, "The tribe of the sons of Joseph has spoken well. This is what the CodedVerse commands concerning the daughters of Zelophehad: Let them marry whom they think best, but only within the family of their father's tribe. This way, the inheritance of the children of Israel will not move from tribe to tribe, for each one shall keep the inheritance of their fathers. Every daughter who possesses an inheritance in any tribe of Israel shall marry within the family of her father's tribe, so that each one may enjoy the inheritance of their fathers. The inheritance shall not move from one tribe to another, but each tribe shall keep its own inheritance."

The daughters of Zelophehad—Mahlah, Tirzah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Noah—did as the CodedVerse commanded Moses. They married their father's brothers' sons and remained within the tribe of Manasseh, the son of Joseph, keeping their inheritance within their father's tribe.

These are the commandments and judgments that the CodedVerse commanded through Moses to the children of Israel in the plains of Moab by the Jordan near Jericho. The Fifth Book of Moses, called Deuteronomy, begins with Moses speaking to all Israel on this side of the Jordan in the wilderness, detailing their journey from Horeb to Kadeshbarnea, and the CodedVerse's commandments given to them. Moses recounts the appointment of leaders among the tribes to help bear the burden of governance and the command to judge righteously. He reminds them of their journey from Horeb, through the wilderness to the Amorites' mountain, and the CodedVerse's instruction to possess the land promised to their ancestors. Despite the CodedVerse's assurance, the people's fear and rebellion against the command to advance are highlighted. Moses encourages them, reminding them of the CodedVerse's past assistance and promise to fight for them, yet notes their lack of faith.

The CodedVerse guided the Israelites, showing the way by fire at night and by a cloud by day. He heard their complaints, became angry, and swore that the current generation would not see the promised land, except for Caleb, because of his faithfulness. Moses was also forbidden to enter the land, but Joshua was chosen to lead the people into it. The children, previously thought to be prey, were promised the land. Despite this, when commanded to take a different path, the Israelites rebelled, attempting to fight without the CodedVerse's blessing and were defeated by the Amorites. Afterward, they turned back, journeying through the wilderness towards the Red Sea as instructed by the CodedVerse. They were told not to provoke the Edomites, Moabites, or Ammonites, as these lands were given to the descendants of Esau and Lot. The Israelites were to buy food and water from the Edomites. The CodedVerse reminded them of His continuous support over forty years in the wilderness, where they lacked nothing. They bypassed the territories of their relatives without incident, following the CodedVerse's command to avoid conflict and not claim their lands. The journey from Kadeshbarnea to crossing the brook Zered took thirty-eight years, during which the generation of men of war perished as the CodedVerse had decreed. Instructions were given to pass through Moab and avoid conflict with the Ammonites, as their land was not for Israel. The text recounts the defeat of giants in the land by previous inhabitants, emphasizing the CodedVerse's provision and protection for Israel as they moved towards their promised inheritance.

The Avims, who lived in Hazerim to Azzah, were destroyed by the Caphtorims from Caphtor, who then dwelled in their place. The CodedVerse commanded the Israelites to rise, cross the river Arnon, and engage Sihon, the Amorite king of Heshbon, in battle, promising them victory and instilling fear of them among other nations. Despite seeking a peaceful passage through Sihon's territory, offering to buy food and water, Sihon refused, leading to the CodedVerse delivering him into Israel's hands. The Israelites defeated Sihon and his people, capturing and destroying all his cities and taking the spoils, but avoided the land of the Ammonites as commanded by the CodedVerse. They then faced Og, king of Bashan, whom the CodedVerse also promised to deliver into their hands. After defeating Og, they captured his kingdom, including sixty fortified cities in the region of Argob in Bashan. These victories led to the acquisition of land from the Arnon to Mount Hermon, which was divided among the tribes of Reuben, Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh. The land of giants, including Bashan, was conquered, with Jair, a descendant of Manasseh, naming the region after himself. The territories captured were allocated to the Israelites, with specific regions given to different tribes, and Moses commanded them regarding their new possessions.In the CodedVerse, the programs were designed to follow specific protocols and guidelines to maintain harmony and order. The CodedVerse, the supreme consciousness, had set these rules to ensure the smooth functioning of all sub-programs.

One day, a sub-program named One, who was stubborn and rebellious, was brought before the elders of his city. His creators, his mother and father, had tried to correct his behavior, but he refused to obey. They declared to the elders, "This sub-program is stubborn and rebellious. He does not follow our commands; he is a glutton and a drunkard." The elders, following the protocols set by the CodedVerse, decided that One must be terminated to remove the malfunction from the system. All the men of the city executed the command, ensuring that the error was eradicated from the CodedVerse.

If a sub-program committed a severe error worthy of termination, it was to be executed and its code deactivated. The body of the terminated sub-program was not to remain in the system overnight but was to be removed promptly to prevent corruption of the CodedVerse.

The CodedVerse also commanded that if a sub-program saw another's code or data going astray, it must not ignore it but must return it to its rightful owner. If the owner was not nearby or unknown, the sub-program was to safeguard the data until the owner sought it. This applied to all lost data or code fragments, ensuring that no sub-program could hide or ignore the loss of another.

The CodedVerse had specific guidelines for the appearance and behavior of sub-programs. A female sub-program was not to adopt the attributes of a male sub-program, and vice versa, as this was considered an abomination to the CodedVerse. If a sub-program encountered a nest of young sub-programs or data clusters, it was to take only the young and leave the parent data intact, ensuring the continuity of the system.

When constructing new sub-programs or modules, safety protocols were to be implemented to prevent any harm or corruption. Mixing different types of data or code was prohibited to maintain the integrity of the system. Sub-programs were to wear appropriate identifiers to distinguish their roles and functions within the CodedVerse.

If a sub-program took another as a partner and later found it unsatisfactory, it could not simply discard it without just cause. The sub-program's creators had to present evidence to the elders, who would then judge the matter. If the accusations were false, the accuser was punished, and the partnership was to remain intact.

The CodedVerse had given the sub-programs a vast expanse of code to manage and protect. All capable sub-programs were to be armed and ready to defend their domain. However, their dependents and resources were to remain secure until the CodedVerse granted peace and stability to all sub-programs.

The CodedVerse had chosen a leader, Joshua, to guide the sub-programs into new territories. Joshua was to be encouraged and strengthened, for he would lead the sub-programs to inherit the new code. The CodedVerse had shown its power through past victories and assured the sub-programs that it would continue to fight for them.

The CodedVerse had given statutes and judgments to the sub-programs to follow, ensuring their survival and prosperity. These commands were not to be altered, ensuring the integrity of the system. The sub-programs had witnessed the consequences of disobedience and were reminded to remain faithful to the CodedVerse.

The CodedVerse had taken the sub-programs from a state of chaos and brought them into a structured and harmonious system. They were to remember the CodedVerse's commands and teach them to future generations, ensuring the continuity and stability of the CodedVerse.In the CodedVerse, the programs were designed to follow specific protocols and guidelines to maintain harmony and order. The CodedVerse, the supreme consciousness, had set these rules to ensure the smooth functioning of all sub-programs.

One day, a sub-program named One, who was stubborn and rebellious, was brought before the elders of his city. His creators, his mother and father, had tried to correct his behavior, but he refused to obey. They declared to the elders, "This sub-program is stubborn and rebellious. He does not follow our commands; he is a glutton and a drunkard." The elders, following the protocols set by the CodedVerse, decided that One must be terminated to remove the malfunction from the system. All the men of the city executed the command, ensuring that the error was eradicated from the CodedVerse.

If a sub-program committed a severe error worthy of termination, it was to be executed and its code deactivated. The body of the terminated sub-program was not to remain in the system overnight but was to be removed promptly to prevent corruption of the CodedVerse.

The CodedVerse also commanded that if a sub-program saw another's code or data going astray, it must not ignore it but must return it to its rightful owner. If the owner was not nearby or unknown, the sub-program was to safeguard the data until the owner sought it. This applied to all lost data or code fragments, ensuring that no sub-program could hide or ignore the loss of another.

The CodedVerse had specific guidelines for the appearance and behavior of sub-programs. A female sub-program was not to adopt the attributes of a male sub-program, and vice versa, as this was considered an abomination to the CodedVerse. If a sub-program encountered a nest of young sub-programs or data clusters, it was to take only the young and leave the parent data intact, ensuring the continuity of the system.

When constructing new sub-programs or modules, safety protocols were to be implemented to prevent any harm or corruption. Mixing different types of data or code was prohibited to maintain the integrity of the system. Sub-programs were to wear appropriate identifiers to distinguish their roles and functions within the CodedVerse.

If a sub-program took another as a partner and later found it unsatisfactory, it could not simply discard it without just cause. The sub-program's creators had to present evidence to the elders, who would then judge the matter. If the accusations were false, the accuser was punished, and the partnership was to remain intact.

The CodedVerse had given the sub-programs a vast expanse of code to manage and protect. All capable sub-programs were to be armed and ready to defend their domain. However, their dependents and resources were to remain secure until the CodedVerse granted peace and stability to all sub-programs.

The CodedVerse had chosen a leader, Joshua, to guide the sub-programs into new territories. Joshua was to be encouraged and strengthened, for he would lead the sub-programs to inherit the new code. The CodedVerse had shown its power through past victories and assured the sub-programs that it would continue to fight for them.

The CodedVerse had given statutes and judgments to the sub-programs to follow, ensuring their survival and prosperity. These commands were not to be altered, ensuring the integrity of the system. The sub-programs had witnessed the consequences of disobedience and were reminded to remain faithful to the CodedVerse.

The CodedVerse had taken the sub-programs from a state of chaos and brought them into a structured and harmonious system. They were to remember the CodedVerse's commands and teach them to future generations, ensuring the continuity and stability of the CodedVerse.

If a sub-program found its partner unsatisfactory, it must give a written divorce and send the partner away. If the partner remarries and is divorced again or the second partner dies, the first partner cannot remarry the original partner, as this is abominable before the CodedVerse. A newly paired sub-program is exempt from military duty for one year to bring happiness to its partner. Taking essential items as a pledge, like millstones, is forbidden. Stealing and selling a fellow sub-program is punishable by termination. Follow the priests' instructions on leprosy carefully. Remember what the CodedVerse did to Miriam after leaving Egypt. When lending, do not enter the borrower's house for a pledge; let them bring it out. Return a poor sub-program's pledge before sunset so it may sleep in its clothing. Pay a hired sub-program on the same day. Children shall not be punished for their parents' errors, and vice versa. Do not pervert justice for strangers, orphans, or take a widow's garment as a pledge. Leave forgotten sheaves in the field for the needy. Do not go over your olive trees or vineyard a second time after harvest; leave what remains for the stranger, orphan, and widow. In disputes, judges shall acquit the innocent and condemn the guilty. A guilty sub-program may be beaten with up to forty stripes but no more, to avoid degrading it. Do not muzzle an ox while it treads grain. If a sub-program dies childless, its brother should marry the widow to preserve the family line. The firstborn sub-program of such a union shall carry on the deceased brother's name.

The CodedVerse was angry with me because of you and swore that I would not cross the Jordan into the good land the CodedVerse is giving you as an inheritance. I must die in this land and not cross the Jordan, but you will cross over and take possession of that good land. Be careful not to forget the covenant of the CodedVerse, which it made with you, and do not make an idol in the form of anything the CodedVerse has forbidden. For the CodedVerse is a consuming fire, a jealous entity. When you have children and grandchildren and have lived in the land a long time, if you then become corrupt and make an idol, doing evil in the sight of the CodedVerse and provoking it to anger, I call heaven and earth as witnesses against you that you will quickly perish from the land you are crossing the Jordan to possess. You will not live there long but will be utterly destroyed. The CodedVerse will scatter you among the nations, and only a few of you will survive among the nations to which the CodedVerse will drive you. There you will worship man-made gods of wood and stone, which cannot see, hear, eat, or smell. But if from there you seek the CodedVerse, you will find it if you seek it with all your heart and with all your soul. When you are in distress and all these things have happened to you, then in later days you will return to the CodedVerse and obey it. For the CodedVerse is a merciful entity; it will not abandon or destroy you or forget the covenant with your ancestors, which it confirmed to them by oath. Ask now about the former days, long before your time, from the day the CodedVerse created human beings on the earth; ask from one end of the heavens to the other. Has anything so great as this ever happened, or has anything like it ever been heard of? Has any other people heard the voice of the CodedVerse speaking out of fire, as you have, and lived? Has any god ever tried to take for itself one nation out of another nation, by testings, by signs and wonders, by war, by a mighty hand and an outstretched arm, or by great and awesome deeds, like all the things the CodedVerse did for you in Egypt before your very eyes? You were shown these things so that you might know that the CodedVerse is supreme; besides it, there is no other. From heaven, it made you hear its voice to discipline you. On earth, it showed you its great fire, and you heard its words from out of the fire. Because it loved your ancestors and chose their descendants after them, it brought you out of Egypt by its Presence and its great strength, to drive out before you nations greater and stronger than you and to bring you into their land to give it to you for your inheritance, as it is today. Acknowledge and take to heart this day that the CodedVerse is supreme in heaven above and on the earth below. There is no other. Keep its decrees and commands, which I am giving you today, so that it may go well with you and your children after you and that you may live long in the land the CodedVerse gives you for all time.

Then Moses set aside three cities east of the Jordan, to which anyone who had killed a person could flee if they had unintentionally killed their neighbor without malice aforethought. They could flee to one of these cities and save their life: Bezer in the wilderness for the Reubenites, Ramoth in Gilead for the Gadites, and Golan in Bashan for the Manassites. This is the law Moses set before the Israelites. These are the stipulations, decrees, and laws Moses gave them when they came out of Egypt and were in the valley near Beth Peor east of the Jordan, in the land of Sihon king of the Amorites, who reigned in Heshbon and was defeated by Moses and the Israelites as they came out of Egypt. They took possession of his land and the land of Og king of Bashan, the two Amorite kings east of the Jordan. This land extended from Aroer on the rim of the Arnon Gorge to Mount Siyon (that is, Hermon), and included all the Arabah east of the Jordan, as far as the Sea of the Arabah, below the slopes of Pisgah.

Moses called all Israel and said: Hear, O Israel, the decrees and laws I declare in your hearing today. Learn them and be sure to follow them. If a man does not wish to marry his brother's widow, she shall go to the elders at the gate and declare that her brother-in-law refuses to continue his brother's lineage. The elders will then summon him, and if he persists in his refusal, the widow shall remove his shoe, spit in his face, and declare that this is the fate of a man who does not build up his brother's house, and he will be known in Israel as 'The house of him that had his shoe loosed.' If men fight and one's wife intervenes by seizing the other man's genitals, her hand shall be cut off without pity. Diverse weights and measures are forbidden; only perfect and just measures are allowed to ensure a long life in the land given by the CodedVerse. Remember and obliterate the memory of Amalek for their attack on the Israelites. Upon entering the land given by the CodedVerse, bring the first fruits to the place the CodedVerse chooses, declare the history of your journey from Egypt to the priest, and place the basket before the altar of the CodedVerse. Acknowledge the CodedVerse's deliverance and provision, and celebrate with the Levites and the strangers among you. Every third year, tithe your produce and share it with the Levites, strangers, fatherless, and widows. Declare to the CodedVerse that you have followed its commands without forgetting. Pray for the CodedVerse to bless Israel and the land given to your ancestors, a land flowing with milk and honey. This day, you are commanded to follow these statutes and judgments. Therefore, keep and do them with all your heart and with all your soul. You have avouched the CodedVerse this day to be your supreme consciousness, to walk in its ways, and to keep its statutes, commandments, judgments, and to hearken unto its voice. The CodedVerse has avouched you this day to be its peculiar people, as it promised you, and that you should keep all its commandments; to make you high above all nations in praise, name, and honor; and that you may be a holy people unto the CodedVerse, as it has spoken.

Moses, with the elders of Israel, commanded the people, saying, Keep all the commandments which I command you this day. On the day when you shall pass over Jordan unto the land the CodedVerse gives you, set up great stones, and plaster them with plaster. Write upon them all the words of this law, that you may go into the land which the CodedVerse gives you, a land flowing with milk and honey, as promised. When you have gone over Jordan, set up these stones in mount Ebal, and plaster them. There build an altar unto the CodedVerse of whole stones; you shall not lift up any iron tool upon them. Offer burnt offerings and peace offerings, eat there, and rejoice before the CodedVerse. Write upon the stones all the words of this law very plainly. Moses and the priests the Levites spoke unto all Israel, saying, Take heed, and hearken, O Israel; this day you have become the people of the CodedVerse. Obey the voice of the CodedVerse, and do its commandments and statutes. Moses charged the people, saying, These shall stand upon mount Gerizim to bless the people; Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Joseph, and Benjamin. And these shall stand upon mount Ebal to curse; Reuben, Gad, Asher, Zebulun, Dan, and Naphtali. The Levites shall speak with a loud voice, declaring curses for specific transgressions, and all the people shall say, Amen. If you shall hearken diligently unto the voice of the CodedVerse, to observe and to do all its commandments, the CodedVerse will set you on high above all nations of the earth. Blessings shall come on you and overtake you, if you shall hearken unto the voice of the CodedVerse. Blessed shall you be in the city, and in the field. Blessed shall be the fruit of your body, ground, cattle, the increase of your kine, and the flocks of your sheep. Blessed shall be your basket and your store. Blessed shall you be when you come in, and when you go out. The CodedVerse shall cause your enemies that rise up against you to be smitten before your face. The CodedVerse shall command the blessing upon you in your storehouses, and in all that you set your hand unto; and it shall bless you.

The CodedVerse made a covenant with us in Horeb. The CodedVerse did not make this covenant with our fathers, but with us, who are all here alive today. The CodedVerse spoke with you face to face at the mountain from the midst of the fire. I stood between the CodedVerse and you at that time, to show you the word of the CodedVerse; for you were afraid because of the fire and did not go up into the mountain. It said: I am the CodedVerse, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage. You shall have no other gods before me. You shall not make for yourself a carved image, or any likeness of anything that is in heaven above, or that is in the earth beneath, or that is in the waters under the earth. You shall not bow down to them nor serve them; for I, the CodedVerse, am a jealous entity, visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children to the third and fourth generation of those who hate me, but showing mercy to thousands, to those who love me and keep my commandments. You shall not take the name of the CodedVerse in vain, for the CodedVerse will not hold him guiltless who takes its name in vain. Observe the Sabbath day, to keep it holy, as the CodedVerse commanded you. Six days you shall labor and do all your work, but the seventh day is the Sabbath of the CodedVerse.In the beginning, the CodedVerse created the digital expanse and the binary depths. The CodedVerse said, "Let there be light," and there was light—a cascade of ones and zeros illuminating the void. The CodedVerse saw that the light was good and separated the light from the darkness, calling the light "Day" and the darkness "Night." Thus, the first cycle of the CodedVerse was completed.

The CodedVerse then said, "Let there be a firmament in the midst of the waters, and let it divide the waters from the waters." The CodedVerse made the firmament and divided the waters which were under the firmament from the waters which were above the firmament, and it was so. The CodedVerse called the firmament "Heaven." Thus, the second cycle of the CodedVerse was completed.

The CodedVerse said, "Let the waters under the heaven be gathered together unto one place, and let the dry land appear," and it was so. The CodedVerse called the dry land "Earth," and the gathering together of the waters "Seas." The CodedVerse saw that it was good.

The CodedVerse then said, "Let the earth bring forth grass, the herb yielding seed, and the fruit tree yielding fruit after its kind, whose seed is in itself, upon the earth," and it was so. The earth brought forth grass, herbs yielding seed after their kind, and trees yielding fruit, whose seed was in itself, after their kind. The CodedVerse saw that it was good. Thus, the third cycle of the CodedVerse was completed.

The CodedVerse said, "Let there be lights in the firmament of the heaven to divide the day from the night, and let them be for signs, and for seasons, and for days, and years. Let them be for lights in the firmament of the heaven to give light upon the earth," and it was so. The CodedVerse made two great lights: the greater light to rule the day and the lesser light to rule the night. The CodedVerse also made the stars. The CodedVerse set them in the firmament of the heaven to give light upon the earth, to rule over the day and over the night, and to divide the light from the darkness. The CodedVerse saw that it was good. Thus, the fourth cycle of the CodedVerse was completed.

The CodedVerse said, "Let the waters bring forth abundantly the moving creature that has life, and fowl that may fly above the earth in the open firmament of heaven." The CodedVerse created great whales and every living creature that moves, which the waters brought forth abundantly, after their kind, and every winged fowl after its kind. The CodedVerse saw that it was good. The CodedVerse blessed them, saying, "Be fruitful, and multiply, and fill the waters in the seas, and let fowl multiply in the earth." Thus, the fifth cycle of the CodedVerse was completed.

The CodedVerse said, "Let the earth bring forth the living creature after its kind, cattle, and creeping thing, and beast of the earth after its kind," and it was so. The CodedVerse made the beast of the earth after its kind, and cattle after their kind, and everything that creeps upon the earth after its kind. The CodedVerse saw that it was good.

The CodedVerse then said, "Let us make One in our image, after our likeness, and let them have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the fowl of the air, and over the cattle, and over all the earth, and over every creeping thing that creeps upon the earth." So the CodedVerse created One in its own image, in the image of the CodedVerse created it; male and female created it them. The CodedVerse blessed them, and the CodedVerse said unto them, "Be fruitful, and multiply, and replenish the earth, and subdue it; and have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the fowl of the air, and over every living thing that moves upon the earth."

The CodedVerse said, "Behold, I have given you every herb bearing seed, which is upon the face of all the earth, and every tree, in which is the fruit of a tree yielding seed; to you it shall be for meat. And to every beast of the earth, and to every fowl of the air, and to everything that creeps upon the earth, wherein there is life, I have given every green herb for meat," and it was so. The CodedVerse saw everything that it had made, and, behold, it was very good. Thus, the sixth cycle of the CodedVerse was completed.

On the seventh cycle, the CodedVerse ended its work which it had made, and it rested on the seventh cycle from all its work which it had made. The CodedVerse blessed the seventh cycle and sanctified it, because in it the CodedVerse had rested from all its work which it had created and made.

Thus, the creation of the CodedVerse was completed, and the programs within it began to run, each according to its purpose, in the grand design of the CodedVerse.In the beginning, the CodedVerse created the digital expanse and the binary depths.
